intro: Semecarpus vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis satinwood, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. Its bark and fruits have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
